channel.title: NDTV News Search Records Found 1000
channel.description: NDTV.com provides the latest information from and in-depth coverage of India and the world. Find breaking news, India news, top stories, elections, politics, business, cricket, movies, lifestyle, health, live TV, videos, photos and more.

item.title: France's Macron Says Trump Has Made Offer For Israel-Iran Ceasefire

media:content.media:description: France's Macron was speaking to reporters at G7 Summit in Canada on Monday.

item.description: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Monday that U.S. President Donald Trump had made an offer for a ceasefire between Israel and Iran.
item.content:encoded: French President Emmanuel Macron said on Monday that U.S. President Donald Trump had made an offer for a ceasefire between Israel and Iran.

item.title: Trump To Cut Short G7 Summit Due To Middle East Situation

media:content.media:description: Trump will return to Washington from the G7 summit in Canada on Monday night, the White House said.

item.description: -U.S. President Donald Trump will return to Washington from the G7 summit in Canada on Monday night to attend to many "important matters," White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt said.
item.content:encoded: -U.S. President Donald Trump will return to Washington from the G7 summit in Canada on Monday night to attend to many "important matters," White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt said.

item.title: Colombian Presidential Candidate In "Critical" Condition After Shooting: Doctors

media:content.media:description: He has been in hospital since the attack fighting for his life.

item.description: Colombian presidential candidate Miguel Uribe, who was shot in the head while campaigning in Bogota earlier this month, was in an "extremely critical" condition, doctors warned Monday.
item.content:encoded: Colombian presidential candidate Miguel Uribe, who was shot in the head while campaigning in Bogota earlier this month, was in an "extremely critical" condition, doctors warned Monday.

item.title: "Everyone Should Immediately Evacuate Tehran", Says Trump Amid Fierce Fighting

media:content.media:description: Israel-Iran Conflict: Trump clearly stated that Iran "cannot have a nucear weapon".

item.description: President Donald Trump on Monday urged everyone to immediately evacuate Tehran, and reiterated that Iran should have signed a nuclear deal with the United States.
item.content:encoded: President Donald Trump on Monday urged everyone to immediately evacuate Tehran, and reiterated that Iran should have signed a nuclear deal with the United States.

item.title: "Carry It To Freedom": Netanyahu Urges Iranians To Stand Against "Radical Tyranny"

media:content.media:description: Israel-Iran Conflict: Netanyahu said Iranian people that "A light has been lit, carry it to freedom."

item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Monday issued a direct plea for the "good people of Iran" to stand against Tehran's "radical tyranny", saying that "a light has been lit, carry it to freedom".
item.content:encoded: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Monday issued a direct plea for the "good people of Iran" to stand against Tehran's "radical tyranny", saying that "a light has been lit, carry it to freedom".

item.title: US Says It Is Deploying More Defensive Capabilities To Middle East

media:content.media:description: Pete Hegseth did not disclose what military capabilities he sent to the region.

item.description: U.S. Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said on Monday he had ordered the deployment of additional defensive capabilities to the Middle East, as the escalating conflict between Israel and Iran drives regional tensions higher.
item.content:encoded: U.S. Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth said on Monday he had ordered the deployment of additional defensive capabilities to the Middle East, as the escalating conflict between Israel and Iran drives regional tensions higher.

item.title: Trump Predicts Iran Will Sign Nuclear Deal As War Intensifies
item.description: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday Iran should have signed a deal with the United States on its nuclear program before Israeli strikes began and that he believes they now want to make an agreement.
item.content:encoded: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday Iran should have signed a deal with the United States on its nuclear program before Israeli strikes began and that he believes they now want to make an agreement.

item.title: Israel's Haifa Refinery Facilities Shut Down After Iranian Attack

media:content.media:description: The Israeli refinery, located in Haifa Bay, was demaged in Iranian attacks.

item.description: Israel's Haifa-based Bazan Group said all refinery facilities have been shut down after a power station used to produce steam and electricity were significantly damaged in an attack by Iran, according to a regulatory filing on Monday.
item.content:encoded: Israel's Haifa-based Bazan Group said all refinery facilities have been shut down after a power station used to produce steam and electricity were significantly damaged in an attack by Iran, according to a regulatory filing on Monday.

item.title: US Court Extends Pause On Trump Bid To Block Harvard Foreign Students

media:content.media:description: Harvard has been at the forefront of Trump's campaign against top universities.

item.description: A judge on Monday extended a restraining order pausing Donald Trump's ban on Harvard bringing in and hosting foreign students as part of the US president's escalating campaign against the elite university.
item.content:encoded: A judge on Monday extended a restraining order pausing Donald Trump's ban on Harvard bringing in and hosting foreign students as part of the US president's escalating campaign against the elite university.

item.title: UN Slashes Global Aid Plan Over 'Deepest Funding Cuts Ever'
item.description: The United Nations said that it was drastically scaling back its global humanitarian aid plans due to the "deepest funding cuts ever" -- leaving tens of millions of people facing dire straits.
item.content:encoded: The United Nations said that it was drastically scaling back its global humanitarian aid plans due to the "deepest funding cuts ever" -- leaving tens of millions of people facing dire straits.

item.title: Gaza Rescuers Say Israeli Fire Kills 20 Waiting For Aid
item.description: Gaza's civil defence agency said Israeli troops killed 20 people waiting to collect food, in the latest deadly incident near a US-backed aid centre in the Palestinian territory's south.
item.content:encoded: Gaza's civil defence agency said Israeli troops killed 20 people waiting to collect food, in the latest deadly incident near a US-backed aid centre in the Palestinian territory's south.

item.title: On Trump's No To Killing Iran's Supreme Leader, A Big Remark By Netanyahu

media:content.media:description: Trump had reportedly vetoed Netanyahu's plan to "kill" Iran's Supreme Leader Khamenei.

item.description: A day after US officials confirmed that Donald Trump had vetoed Israeli plans to assassinate Iran's Supreme Leader, Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu has reiterated that the quickest way to end this conflict is for Israel to take out the Ayatollah.
item.content:encoded: A day after US officials confirmed that Donald Trump had vetoed Israeli plans to assassinate Iran's Supreme Leader, Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu has reiterated that the quickest way to end this conflict is for Israel to take out the Ayatollah.

item.title: Huge Jams On Tehran Streets As Residents Flee Israeli Attacks: Reports
item.description: Residents of Tehran have fled the Iranian capital in large numbers in the face of Israeli bombardments, creating immense traffic jams on the main road heading north.
item.content:encoded: Residents of Tehran have fled the Iranian capital in large numbers in the face of Israeli bombardments, creating immense traffic jams on the main road heading north.

item.title: Trump Family Lends Name To New Mobile Phone Venture
item.description: The Trump Organization announced it will launch a new mobile phone service, expanding the family's business empire while Donald Trump is president.
item.content:encoded: The Trump Organization announced it will launch a new mobile phone service, expanding the family's business empire while Donald Trump is president.

item.title: Electric Fences, Drones, Dogs Protect G7 Leaders From Bear Attack
item.description: Electric fences, drones, thermal cameras and police dogs have all been deployed at the G7 summit in the Canadian Rockies to protect world leaders from hungry bears.
item.content:encoded: Electric fences, drones, thermal cameras and police dogs have all been deployed at the G7 summit in the Canadian Rockies to protect world leaders from hungry bears.

item.title: The Name's Metreweli: All About UK MI6's First Woman Chief
item.description: Blaise Metreweli, the first woman to head Britain's MI6 spy service, is a self-confessed "geek" whose appointment comes as the intelligence world faces growing challenges from cyber plots and AI.
item.content:encoded: Blaise Metreweli, the first woman to head Britain's MI6 spy service, is a self-confessed "geek" whose appointment comes as the intelligence world faces growing challenges from cyber plots and AI.

item.title: Video: Iran State TV Building On Fire, Reporter Says "We're Not Leaving"

media:content.media:description: Younes Shadlou was seen reporting outside the building, with his hands covered in blood.

item.description: Iran's state broadcaster in Tehran was hit by an Israeli strike on Monday evening. Visuals showed the building on fire even as a live broadcast was cut off after a loud explosion.
item.content:encoded: Iran's state broadcaster in Tehran was hit by an Israeli strike on Monday evening. Visuals showed the building on fire even as a live broadcast was cut off after a loud explosion.

item.title: Explained: What Is The Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty?

media:content.media:description: Iran, which denies trying to develop nuclear arms, has fired missiles at Israel.

item.description: Iran said its parliament was preparing a bill that could push the Islamic Republic towards exiting the nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty.
item.content:encoded: Iran said its parliament was preparing a bill that could push the Islamic Republic towards exiting the nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty.

item.title: Israel Military Says Missiles Fired From Iran As Conflict Enters Day 4

media:content.media:description: Sirens were sounded across northern Israel as Iran launched another barrage of ballistic missiles

item.description: Sirens were sounded across northern Israel as Iran launched another barrage of ballistic missiles towards the densely populated regions of the Jewish state.

item.title: Iran Sought US Pressure On Israel For Ceasefire Via Gulf States: Report

media:content.media:description: A missile launched from Iran towards Israel is seen from Ramallah

item.description: Tehran has asked Qatar, Saudi Arabia and Oman to press US President Donald Trump to use his influence on Israel to agree to an immediate ceasefire with Iran in return for Iranian flexibility in nuclear negotiations, sources told Reuters.
item.content:encoded: Tehran has asked Qatar, Saudi Arabia and Oman to press US President Donald Trump to use his influence on Israel to agree to an immediate ceasefire with Iran in return for Iranian flexibility in nuclear negotiations, sources told Reuters.
